lead_paragraph: The vice president, Gen. Abdul Rashid Dostum, is accused of having a political rival beaten “in a barbaric way” at a sporting event, before kidnapping him.

byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and FAHIM ABED

headline.print_headline: Afghan Vice President Seen Abducting Rival
headline.main: Afghan Vice President Seen Abducting Rival

snippet: The vice president, Gen. Abdul Rashid Dostum, is accused of having a political rival beaten “in a barbaric way” at a sporting event, before kidnapping him....
abstract: Gen Abdul Rashid Dostum, vice president of Afghanistan, is seen beating political rival Ahmand Ishchi during sporting match, and allowing him to be driven away in armored vehicle; heated scuffle heightens worries over country's leadership at hands of former warlord with reported history of human rights violations and abuses.
